intro: Gouania andamanica var. brevialata, commonly known as the Andaman narrow-leaved gouania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and typically appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland forest areas.
